conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas when it transitions from state D to state A.
Work done by the gas during a process is given by the area under the p-V diagram for that process.
The ABCDA cycle consists of four processes: AB (Isobaric), BC (Adiabatic), CD (Isobaric), DA (Adiabatic).
Focus on the work done during the process from state D to state A.
The area under the p-V diagram from point D to point A represents the work done.
Work done during an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
For process DA, pressure is constant and equal to P1, volume changes from V2 to V1.
Work done by the gas during process DA is W_DA = P1 ΔV = P1 (V1 - V2).
Since the gas is doing work on the surroundings, the work done is negative: W_DA = -P1 (V1 - V2).
The work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A is -P1 (V1 - V2).
